pullRequest.body:
This defines `SSet.hoFunctor`, which constructs a category from a simplicial set.

Co-Authored-By: Emily Riehl <eriehl@jhu.edu> and Pietro Monticone <38562595+pitmonticone@users.noreply.github.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #16779
- [x] depends on: #16780
- [x] depends on: #16781
* Prerequisite for #16784.

### PR summary [74aa6648d9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16783/commits/74aa6648d91fe47ce2f6608c6c0b0c2245d49b00)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.HomotopyCat` (new file)|841|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Functor.congruence_homRel`
`+ Functor.homRel`
`+ Functor.homRel_iff`
`+ HoRel₂`
`+ HoRel₂.ext_triangle`
`+ OneTruncation₂`

`+ OneTruncation₂.ofNerve₂.inv`

`+ OneTruncation₂.ofNerve₂.natIso`

`+ OneTruncation₂.tgt`

`+ ev02₂`

`+ hoFunctor`

`+ hoFunctor₂Map`

`+ hoFunctor₂Obj.quotientFunctor`

`+ δ₂_zero_comp_σ₂_zero`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I would suggest moving the file `AlgebraicTopology.HomotopyCat` to `AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.HomotopyCat` (and then `SimplicalSet` should become `SimplicialSet.Basic`).

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16779~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16780~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16781~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Note: Moving files to `SimplicialSet.*` should be done in a separate PR doing only that.

> Note: Moving files to `SimplicialSet.*` should be done in a separate PR doing only that.

See PR #17620.

> I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.

@jcommelin to clarify, you were suggesting moving `HomotopyCat.lean` out of the `CategoryTheory` namespace and into the `SSet` namespace?

Sorry for being unclear. What I had in mind was to nest the namespaces:
```
namespace CategoryTheory
namespace SSet

...
```
because almost all the names start with `SSet.` already.

I would still insist that there is no reason to duplicate the construction. Before taking the quotient category, the two constructions are defeq. `HoRel₂` and `HoRel` (for the truncation) are obviously not defeq because there are separate types, but it would a very small effort to define `HoRel` in terms of `HoRel₂`.
What I suggest is define first the homotopy category for `2`-truncated simplicial sets. Define the homotopy category of a simplicial set by applying the previous construction to `(SimplexCategory.Truncated.inclusion 2).op ⋙ X`. Then, you may provide a nice helper API for the second construction if you want to hide the internals.
Please note that the truncation has good definitional properties.
@joelriou this makes the cuts that you requested and is now ready for review.
I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.
I think the new file can be wrapped in a `namespace SSet`.

It would be nice to prove this after `functor r` is defined, because it seems this could then be deduced from the fact that `Relation.EqvGen (@CompClosure C _ r X Y)` is, by the basic properties of quotients, the equivalence relation on `X ⟶ Y` such that `f` and `g` are related iff `(functor r).map f = (functor r).map g`. In general, we could also introduce `Functor.homRel` which sends a functor `F` from `C` to `D` to the relation on morphisms on `C` defined by `F.map f = F.map G`, and then we can prove `Congruence F.homRel` (all the fields can be obtained mostly `by aesop`). Then, up to a `rw`, this result would be the particular case `Congruence (functor r).homRel`.

@joelriou I believe I've now implemented all of your suggestions. See

+ Functor.homRel
+ Functor.homRelCongruence
+ functorHomRel_eq_compClosureEqvGen (better name?)
+ compClosure.congruence (I thought that perhaps this should have been lowercase, but maybe that is a mistake)
This notation is also defined in `SimplicialObject.lean`. What would happen if you add `priority := high` in `SimplicialObject.lean` and remove the declaration here?

```suggestion
  S.δ 1 f
```
Using `S.δ` systematically in this file should improve readibility.

```suggestion
  S.δ 0 f
```

The API for simplicial sets should be expanded to include concrete formulations of the simplicial relations, like
```lean
@[simp]
lemma SSet.δ_comp_σ_self_apply (S : SSet) {n} (i : Fin (n + 1)) (x : S _[n]) :
    S.δ i.castSucc (S.σ i x) = x :=
  congr_fun S.δ_comp_σ_self x
```
Similarly, you should add lemmas like `δ_naturality_apply`, `σ_naturality_apply`, which should ease many proofs below.
(This could go in a separate PR.)
Done except for the two naturality statements, which I forgot about, and added here.

Automation should take care of this:
```suggestion
```
If any case, adding a lemma like this would facilitate automation:
```lean
@[ext]
lemma hom_ext {S : SSet} {x y : SSet.OneTruncation S} {f g : x ⟶ y}
    (h : f.1 = g.1) : f = g := by
  cases f; cases g; subst h; rfl
```

It may be advisable to introduce a structure:
```lean
structure SSet.OneTruncation.Hom {S : SSet} (X Y : S _[0]) :=
  arrow : S _[1]
  src : src arrow = X := by aesop_cat
  tgt : tgt arrow = Y := by aesop_cat
```
Then, you may try to setup automation so that in most definitions, `src` and `tgt` are filled automatically.
Unfortunately, this doesn't work, it breaks the proof by refl that the OneTruncation and OneTruncation₂ definitions are equivalent.

```suggestion
  map_id X := by
    obtain ⟨x, rfl⟩ := X.mk₀_surjective
    simp [map, ReflQuiver.id]
 ```

If the `ext` attribute of suitable lemmas is activated, I think that these proofs could become completely automatic (`by aesop_cat`):
```suggestion
  map := fun f => by
    refine ⟨.mk₁ f, ?_⟩
    constructor <;> apply ComposableArrows.ext₀ <;> simp <;> rfl
  map_id := fun X : C => Subtype.ext <| by
    apply ComposableArrows.ext₁ <;> simp <;> rfl
```

It would be really nice to avoid duplication of code here. The only solution I see is to define the reflexive quiver and relations only in the case of a `S : SSet.truncated 2` and then, when we want to apply the construction to fully fledged simplicial sets, we just apply the truncation first. This may require developing the basic API of simplicial relations suggested above for the truncated simplicial objects/simplicial sets as well.

We think it would be better not to deal with this in this PR, but rather wait until we have some usage code before attempting such a refactor, because `OneTruncation` is not an opaque definition and we would prefer for users not to have to deal with the 2-truncation layer when they don't explicitly need it. Refactoring now could be making things harder elsewhere in code that does not exist yet.

```suggestion
```

Adding an `_iff` lemma should facilitate automation:
```suggestion
section

variable {C D : Type*} [Category C] [Category D] (F : C ⥤ D) 

/-- A functor induces a `HomRel` on its domain, relating those maps that have the same image. -/
def Functor.homRel : HomRel C :=
  fun _ _ f g ↦ F.map f = F.map g

@[simp]
lemma Functor.homRel_iff {X Y : C} (f g : X ⟶ Y) :
    F.homRel f g ↔ F.map f = F.map g := Iff.rfl

end
```

This should be an instance:
```suggestion
instance Functor.congruence_homRel {C D : Type*} [Category C] [Category D] (F : C ⥤ D) :
    Congruence F.homRel where
```

The `iff` lemma above makes this work:
```suggestion
  equivalence :=
    { refl := fun _ ↦ rfl
      symm := by aesop
      trans := by aesop }
  compLeft := by aesop
  compRight := by aesop
```

There is a more direct proof. This is almost by definition of quotients:
```suggestion
theorem functor_homRel_eq_compClosure_eqvGen {X Y : C} (f g : X ⟶ Y) :
    (functor r).homRel f g ↔ Relation.EqvGen (@CompClosure C _ r X Y) f g :=
  Quot.eq
```

```suggestion
  convert inferInstanceAs (Congruence (functor r).homRel)
  ext
  rw [functor_homRel_eq_compClosure_eqvGen]
```
Is this name intended to stay? Or is this WIP?
@digama0 what should this have been called?
I think it should be a `private lemma`. Perhaps `map_map_of_eq`?
Done.

I would recommend introducing a structure:
```suggestion
structure OneTruncation₂.Hom {S : SSet.Truncated 2} (X Y : OneTruncation₂ S) where
  edge : S _[1]₂
  src_eq : S.map (δ₂ 1).op edge = X
  tgt_eq : S.map (δ₂ 0).op edge = Y
```

You may introduce a few lemmas like:
```lean
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma δ₂_one_comp_σ₂_zero : δ₂ (1 : Fin 2) ≫ σ₂ 0 = 𝟙 _ := SimplexCategory.δ_comp_σ_succ
```

It seems there is some unnecessary complication here:
```suggestion
inductive HoRel₂ {V : SSet.Truncated 2} :
    (X Y : Cat.FreeRefl (OneTruncation₂ V)) → (f g : X ⟶ Y) → Prop
```

I think it would be better not to use `.nil`, but the `Quiver.Hom.toPath` API:
```suggestion
    HoRel₂ _ _
      (Quot.mk _ (Quiver.Hom.toPath (ev02₂ φ)))
      (Quot.mk _ ((Quiver.Hom.toPath (ev01₂ φ)).comp
        (Quiver.Hom.toPath (ev12₂ φ))))
```

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/HomotopyCat): SSet.hoFunctor

source.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/NerveAdjunction): nerve adjunction, Cat has colimits
